briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Varenicline in Smokers With Cardiovascular Disease Who Wish to Quit Smoking

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Participants must have stable, documented cardiovascular disease (including at least one of the following diagnosed \> 2 months prior to the Screening visit - angina, myocardial infarction (MI), revascularization, transient ischemic attack (TIA), and peripheral vascular disease (PVD).
* Participants that smoke \> 10 cigarettes / day.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Participants with unstable cardiovascular disease
* Cardiovascular events in the past 2 months
* Moderate or severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Responders With Carbon Monoxide (CO) Confirmed 4-week Continuous Quit Rate (CQR) for Last 4 Weeks of Treatment (Trtmt)
outcomeMeasures.description: Participants considered Responders (4-week CQR \<=10 parts per million \<ppm\>) through reports of cigarette or other nicotine use since last study visit, confirmed by measurement of end-expiratory exhaled carbon monoxide (CO). If any CO measurement at a particular timepoint was \>10 ppm, subject was considered to be Non-Responder at that timepoint.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Responders With Continuous Abstinence (CA) Through Week 52
outcomeMeasures.description: Responders: participants who remained abstinent based on 'since the last contact' question in Nicotine Use Inventory 1) "Has participant smoked any cigarettes (even a puff) since last contact?" = No AND 2) "Has participant used any other tobacco products… since last contact?" = No. Participant a non-responder if expired CO \> 10 ppm.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Long-Term Quit Responders
outcomeMeasures.description: Responders: participants were considered Long Term Quit responders if 1) they were responders for the primary endpoint (the 4-week CQR for Weeks 9-12) and 2) had no more than 6 days of smoking from Week 12 through the given visit.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With a Seven-Day Point Prevalence of Abstinence at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Responders: abstinence in previous seven days, defined in the non-treatment follow-up as: 1) "Has the participant smoked any cigarettes in the last 7 days?" = No AND 2) "Has the participant used any other tobacco products in the last 7 days?" = No. Participant a non-responder if expired CO \> 10 ppm.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With a Seven-Day Point Prevalence of Abstinence at Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Responders: abstinence in previous seven days, defined in the non-treatment follow-up as: 1) "Has the participant smoked any cigarettes in the last 7 days?" = No AND 2) "Has the participant used any other tobacco products in the last 7 days?" = No. Participant a non-responder if expired CO \> 10 ppm.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With a Seven-Day Point Prevalence of Abstinence at Week 52
outcomeMeasures.description: Responders: abstinence in previous seven days, defined in the non-treatment follow-up as: 1) "Has the participant smoked any cigarettes in the last 7 days?" = No AND 2) "Has the participant used any other tobacco products in the last 7 days?" = No. Participant a non-responder if expired CO \> 10 ppm.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With a 4 Week Point Prevalence of Smoking Cessation
outcomeMeasures.description: Responders: participants with abstinence during the last 4 weeks of non-treatment based on answering 'no' to both of the two 'last 4 week' questions in the Nicotine Use Inventory (NUI). NUI collected information of cigarette or other nicotine use during the study.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Responders With Continuous Abstinence (CA) Through Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Responders: participants who remained abstinent based on 'since the last contact' question in Nicotine Use Inventory 1) "Has participant smoked any cigarettes (even a puff) since the last contact?" = No AND 2) "Has participant used any other tobacco products… since the last contact?" = No. Non- responder if the expired CO \> 10 ppm at any given timepoint.

outcomeMeasures.title: Cigarettes Smoked Per Day
outcomeMeasures.description: Cigarettes smoked each day during the first 3 weeks of the treatment phase.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Long-Term Quit Responders From Week 9 Through Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Responders: participants were considered Long Term Quit Responders if 1) they were responders for the primary endpoint (the 4-week CQR for Weeks 9-12) and 2) had no more than 6 days of smoking from Week 12 through the given visit.
